values: Eve smiles sweetly. Why not matriarchy? Mmm...I think that would be Boston. I just like the city. I adore the libraries, the museums...and the overall atmosphere. The weather, the people, the food I get... Bet you thought I'd say Eden, didn't you?

Rather dropped off the face of the earth, haven't I? I assure you there's a reason, but it's not really one I want to think about much. Suffice it to say, I'm back and trying to catch up. As for this week's question: *grins* Oh, come on. You're asking me what the most important decision I ever made was? Take a guess, people.

I want a family dinner.  One where no one is killed, where no one reveals they're sleeping with another family member, where there are no fights, no screaming, no lies, no snark.

I just want a family dinner.

*sighs*  I love the sound of a small body sighing in their sleep.  So sweet.  So peaceful.

I think Sorcerer will benefit from Willy.  And he and Metatron shall benefit from each other.  If for no reason than they have similar personalities, in some ways, and can grouch to each other.  *smiles*
Oh.  Cain's here.  This will be interesting.

I was up and thought to take that wing quiz that was going around. On two questions, though, I was torn between two answers. So I took it twice, one with the one set of answers, and one with the other, and got two results. I then mixed up the two choices in the two questions into different combinations. Still I got the same two results. Why am I confused? Well...because
You are one of the few out there whose wings are
truly ANGELIC. Selfless, powerful, and
divine, you are one blessed with a certain
cosmic grace. You are unequalled in
peacefulness, love, and beauty. As a Being of
Light your wings are massive and a soft white
or silver. Countless feathers grace them and
radiate the light within you for all the world
to see. You are a defender, protector, and
caretaker. Comforter of the weak and forgiver
of the wrong, chances are you are taken
advantage of once in awhile, maybe quite often.
But your innocence and wisdom sees the good in
everyone and so this mistreatment does not make
you colder. Merciful to the extreme, you will
try to help misguided souls find themselves and
peace. However not all Angelics allow
themselves to be gotten the better of - the
Seraphim for example will be driven to fighting
for the sake of Justice and protection of those
less powerful. Congratulations - and don't ever
change - the world needs more people like you.

*~*~*Claim Your Wings - Pics and Long Answers*~*~*
brought to you by Quizilla.
Yours are DEMON wings, possibly resembling
those of a bat - huge, black, and clawed. You
are cold and impure, and a born Creature of the
Night. Possibly with an interest in those of a
vampyric nature, or possibly one yourself. You
have little sympathy or care for humanity and
see them as existing for no real purpose -
thus, you can be very manipulative and bend
them to fit YOUR purpose. And you do have a
purpose, to everything you do. Nine times out
of ten it will be strictly for your own self
gratification or perhaps merely amusement. As
soon as a person or situation is no longer
productive or pleasurable in your life, you
will rid yourself of it or them. You could very
well have just a touch of superiority complex
(or perhaps more than a touch?). Despite all of
this, you are capable of love so intense that
you place that person's wishes even above your
own - the only time that you will do so.
Chances are you are attracted to people in
which you see...yourself. Though many hate you
for your carelessness and evil...Sexy, fierce,
sinful, and mysterious...you turn me on.

*~*~*Claim Your Wings - Pics and Long Answers*~*~*
brought to you by Quizilla Story of my life. And death. ...I think I'll go check on Willy.
Dear God, Drusilla, what have you gotten me into?
*looks at Willy, holding him carefully* Um. Metatron? I think I may have done something that...I may not exactly have been supposed to do.

Sorry to those I was talking to a bit ago.  Marital issues arose and I've been dealing with Adam.

Sometimes I wonder why I love that man.

I am more than a little worried about <lj user="metatron_tm"> and <lj user="5min_freestyle">, but it's not my place to say anything.  

Now, will that stop me?  Probably not.  But it means I'll at least try to be quiet.

And I'm still amused at the thought of <lj user="bringerof_light"> in love.  It just doesn't work.  It does, however, worry me a little more.

I really don't think it's anyone's business but mine.  Anyway, at the time, I didn't even know there was such a concept.  

Sorry if this disappoints, though I can't see how it could.

*considers* I don't really forgive. Not completely, at least. Don't get me wrong, I'm thrilled, overjoyed, absolutely delirious with happiness that He forgave me. I don't know what I would have done if He hadn't. But it's not something I do. Or did. I mean, think about it. I had children and a husband to keep alive and protect, as much from each other as anyone else. There wasn't room for forgiveness. When Cain killed Abel, I couldn't forgive him. Not completely at least. I had to take care of the others, and he was a danger to them. He killed my son. So instead I lost two sons. But it was what had to be done. But self-preservation doesn't matter to me, either. Only worry for my children. They're both good things. They're both important. And that's all I can say on that matter.
Angels? Very good at the guilt thing. Even when they don't mean to. And oh, Drusilla. *shakes head* I wish you were right, lovely, but I fucked that one up.

Of course. 

I was made by Him from Adam for Adam. I was made to love. And I did and do. 

That's just how it is. 

But...with Adam, at least...it's harder to make the love last.  I loved him from the moment I saw him, which was right after He gave me life.  But he blames me for us being cast out.  And I don't think he's ever quite forgiven me.

From Genesis:

"So God created humankind in His image,
in the image of God He created them,
male and female he created them."

"This one will be called Woman,
for out of Man this one was taken."

"This one" would be me, Eve, mother of life, one of your ancestors, if your human.  Rabbis and priests and preachers for millenia have hated me and blamed the mess the world's in on me.

And I'm not denying I messed up, big time.

But I have a side of the story to tell, too, if you're willing to listen.
